title: Director of Design
description: Leading a business unit of 40+ designers, working with the executive team to set strategic goals, and supporting leaders in Communication Design, Product Design, and Design Operations.

title: Principal Designer
description:
As Principal Designer, I continued to manage Product Design teams, while establishing and leading our Design Ops function.

One of my key contributions was setting the vision for a new version our Design System, rethinking how a design system can add value beyond a product organization and becoming a key value prop for enterprise customers.
responsibilities: Establishing and leading Design Ops function
Setting vision for a new version of Design System
key_contributions: Rethinking how a design system can add value beyond a product organization
Becoming a key value prop for enterprise customers

title: Senior Product Design Manager
description: After working with Liferay’s first Director of Design to establish design as a standalone business unit, I began managing internationally and helped grow and lead other managers.

title: UX Design Manager
description: After spending 3 years gaining a deep understanding of our product and customers in my role as Web Designer, I moved to a product team tasked with developing an MVP for an entirely new product line. I also grew the UX team based in our LA office from 4 to 8.
responsibilities: Developing MVP for an entirely new product line
Growing the UX team from 4 to 8

title: Web Designer
description: Liferay’s first web designer, I was hired to design and build pages to support our marketing efforts. I quickly took responsibility for all of our web properties and built a small team with 2 other designers.
responsibilities: Designing and building pages to support marketing efforts
Taking responsibility for all web properties
